```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
library(here)
```

#loading in the data
```{r}
econ_data <- read.csv(here("data", "HW2_Water.csv")) %>% 
  clean_names()
```

```{r}
plot(econ_data$mc_agriculture)

ggplot(data = econ_data, aes(x = quantity, y = mc_agriculture)) + geom_point()

res = lm(mc_agriculture~quantity, data = econ_data)
summary(res)
ggplot(data = econ_data, aes(x = quantity, y = mc_agriculture)) + stat_summary(fun.y = "mean", geom = "point", col = "blue", size =2) + geom_smooth(method = "lm")
```

mc_ag P = -3.167 + 5.1025Q



```{r}
#trying to plot them all together
ggplot(data = econ_data, aes(x = quantity, y = mc_agriculture)) + geom_point(col = "red")+
  stat_smooth(method=lm, col = "red", se = FALSE)+
  geom_point(data = econ_data, aes(x = quantity, y = mc_meat), col = "blue") + stat_smooth(aes(x=quantity, y = mc_meat), method = lm, col = "blue", se=FALSE)+
  geom_point(data = econ_data, aes(x = quantity, y = mc_industrial), col = "orange") + stat_smooth(aes(x=quantity, y = mc_industrial), method = lm, col = "orange", se=FALSE)+
  geom_point(data = econ_data, aes(x = quantity, y = mc_urban), col = "green") + stat_smooth(aes(x=quantity, y = mc_urban), method = lm, col = "green", se=FALSE) + 
  labs(x = "Quantity of Water (Acre Feet)" , y = "Marginal Cost ($/Acre Foot)", title = "Marginal Cost of Industries")+
  theme_minimal()+
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5), axis.line = element_line(size =1, color = "black"))
```
